CreateStreamLiveChannel.document: This API is used to create a StreamLive channel.
CreateStreamLiveChannel.name: Creates a StreamLive channel

CreateStreamLiveInput.document: This API is used to create a StreamLive input.
CreateStreamLiveInput.name: Creates a StreamLive input

CreateStreamLiveInputSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to create an input security group. Up to 5 security groups are allowed.
CreateStreamLiveInputSecurityGroup.name: Creates an input security group

CreateStreamLivePlan.document: This API is used to create an event in the plan.
CreateStreamLivePlan.name: Creates an event in the plan

CreateStreamLiveWatermark.document: This API is used to add a watermark.
CreateStreamLiveWatermark.name: Adds a watermark

DeleteStreamLiveChannel.document: This API is used to delete a StreamLive channel.
DeleteStreamLiveChannel.name: Deletes a StreamLive channel

DeleteStreamLiveInput.document: This API is used to delete a StreamLive input.
DeleteStreamLiveInput.name: Deletes a StreamLive input

DeleteStreamLiveInputSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to delete an input security group.
DeleteStreamLiveInputSecurityGroup.name: Deletes an input security group

DeleteStreamLivePlan.document: This API is used to delete a StreamLive event.
DeleteStreamLivePlan.name: Deletes a StreamLive event

DeleteStreamLiveWatermark.document: This API is used to delete a watermark.
DeleteStreamLiveWatermark.name: Deletes a watermark

DescribeStreamLiveChannel.document: This API is used to query a StreamLive channel.
DescribeStreamLiveChannel.name: Queries a StreamLive channel

DescribeStreamLiveChannelAlerts.document: This API is used to query the alarm information of a StreamLive channel.
DescribeStreamLiveChannelAlerts.name: Queries the alarm information of a StreamLive channel

DescribeStreamLiveChannelInputStatistics.document: This API is used to query input statistics.
DescribeStreamLiveChannelInputStatistics.name: Queries input statistics

DescribeStreamLiveChannelLogs.document: This API is used to query StreamLive channel logs, such as push event logs.
DescribeStreamLiveChannelLogs.name: Queries StreamLive channel logs

DescribeStreamLiveChannelOutputStatistic.document: This API is used to query the output statistics of a StreamLive channel.
DescribeStreamLiveChannelOutputStatistic.name: Queries the output statistics of a StreamLive channel

DescribeStreamLiveChannels.document: This API is used to query StreamLive channels in batches.
DescribeStreamLiveChannels.name: Queries StreamLive channels in batches

DescribeStreamLiveInput.document: This API is used to query a StreamLive input.
DescribeStreamLiveInput.name: Queries a StreamLive input

DescribeStreamLiveInputSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to query an input security group.
DescribeStreamLiveInputSecurityGroup.name: Queries an input security group

DescribeStreamLiveInputSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query input security groups in batches.
DescribeStreamLiveInputSecurityGroups.name: Queries input security groups in batches

DescribeStreamLiveInputs.document: This API is used to query StreamLive inputs in batches.
DescribeStreamLiveInputs.name: Queries StreamLive inputs in batches

DescribeStreamLivePlans.document: This API is used to query the events in the plan in batches.
DescribeStreamLivePlans.name: Queries events in batches

DescribeStreamLiveRegions.document: This API is used to query all StreamLive regions.
DescribeStreamLiveRegions.name: Queries StreamLive regions

DescribeStreamLiveTranscodeDetail.document: This API is used to query the transcoding information of StreamLive streams.
DescribeStreamLiveTranscodeDetail.name: Queries transcoding information

DescribeStreamLiveWatermark.document: This API is used to query a watermark.
DescribeStreamLiveWatermark.name: Queries a watermark

DescribeStreamLiveWatermarks.document: This API is used to query multiple watermarks at a time.
DescribeStreamLiveWatermarks.name: Queries multiple watermarks at a time

ModifyStreamLiveChannel.document: This API is used to modify a StreamLive channel.
ModifyStreamLiveChannel.name: Modifies a StreamLive channel

ModifyStreamLiveInput.document: This API is used to modify a StreamLive input.
ModifyStreamLiveInput.name: Modifies a StreamLive input

ModifyStreamLiveInputSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to modify an input security group.
ModifyStreamLiveInputSecurityGroup.name: Modifies an input security group

ModifyStreamLiveWatermark.document: This API is used to modify a watermark.
ModifyStreamLiveWatermark.name: Modifies a watermark

QueryInputStreamState.document: This API is used to query the stream status of a StreamLive input.
QueryInputStreamState.name: Queries the stream status of an input

StartStreamLiveChannel.document: This API is used to start a StreamLive channel.
StartStreamLiveChannel.name: Starts a StreamLive channel

StopStreamLiveChannel.document: This API is used to stop a StreamLive channel.
StopStreamLiveChannel.name: Stops a StreamLive channel

members.document: Name of an audio/video transcoding template, which can contain 1-20 case-sensitive letters and digits
members.name: Name

members.document: Whether video is needed. `0`: not needed; `1`: needed
members.name: NeedVideo

members.document: Video codec. Valid values: `H264`, `H265`. If this parameter is left empty, the original video codec will be used.
members.name: Vcodec

members.document: Video width. Value range: (0, 3000]. The value must be an integer multiple of 4. If this parameter is left empty, the original video width will be used.
members.name: Width

members.document: Video height. Value range: (0, 3000]. The value must be an integer multiple of 4. If this parameter is left empty, the original video height will be used.
members.name: Height

members.document: Video frame rate. Value range: [1, 240]. If this parameter is left empty, the original frame rate will be used.
members.name: Fps

members.document: Whether to enable top speed codec transcoding. Valid values: `CLOSE` (disable), `OPEN` (enable). Default value: `CLOSE`
members.name: TopSpeed

members.document: Compression ratio for top speed codec transcoding. Value range: [0, 50]. The lower the compression ratio, the higher the image quality.
members.name: BitrateCompressionRatio

members.document: Whether audio is needed. `0`: not needed; `1`: needed
members.name: NeedAudio

members.document: Audio codec. Valid value: `AAC` (default)
members.name: Acodec

members.document: Video bitrate. Value range: [50000, 40000000]. The value must be an integer multiple of 1000. If this parameter is left empty, the original bitrate will be used.
members.name: VideoBitrate

members.document: Bitrate control mode. Valid values: `CBR`, `ABR` (default)
members.name: RateControlMode

members.document: Watermark ID
members.name: WatermarkId

members.document: Whether to convert audio to text. `0` (default): No; `1`: Yes.
members.name: SmartSubtitles

members.document:
The subtitle settings. Currently, the following subtitles are supported:
`eng2eng`: English speech to English text.
`eng2chs`: English speech to Chinese text. 
`eng2chseng`: English speech to English and Chinese text. 
`chs2chs`: Chinese speech to Chinese text.   
`chs2eng`: Chinese speech to English text. 
`chs2chseng`: Chinese speech to Chinese and English text.
members.name: SubtitleConfiguration

members.document: Input ID
members.name: Id

members.document:
Audio selector for the input. There can be 0 to 20 audio selectors.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: AudioSelectors

members.document:
Pull mode. If the input type is `HLS_PULL` or `MP4_PULL`, you can set this parameter to `LOOP` or `ONCE`. `LOOP` is the default value.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: PullBehavior

members.document:
Input failover configuration
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: FailOverSettings

members.document: Audio `Pid`. Default value: 0.
members.name: Pid

members.document: Audio FPS.
members.name: Fps

members.document: Audio bitrate in bps.
members.name: Rate

members.document: Audio `Pid`, which is available only if the input is `rtp/udp`.
members.name: Pid

members.document: Audio name, which can contain 1-32 letters, digits, and underscores.
members.name: Name

members.document: Audio `Pid` selection.
members.name: AudioPidSelection

members.document: Only `AttachedInputs.AudioSelectors.Name` can be selected. This parameter is required for RTP_PUSH and UDP_PUSH.
members.name: AudioSelectorName

members.document: Audio transcoding template name, which can contain 1-20 letters and digits.
members.name: Name

members.document: Audio codec. Valid value: AAC. Default value: AAC.
members.name: Acodec

members.document: Audio language code, whose length is always 3 characters.
members.name: LanguageCode

members.document: Alarm details of pipeline 0 under this channel.
members.name: Pipeline0

members.document: Alarm details of pipeline 1 under this channel.
members.name: Pipeline1

members.document: Input ID.
members.name: InputId

members.document: Input statistics.
members.name: Statistics

members.document: Output group name.
members.name: OutputGroupName

members.document: Output group statistics.
members.name: Statistics

members.document: Alarm start time in UTC time.
members.name: SetTime

members.document:
Alarm end time in UTC time.
This time is available only after the alarm ends.
members.name: ClearTime

members.document: Alarm type.
members.name: Type

members.document: Alarm details.
members.name: Message

members.document: Image file format. Valid values: png, jpg.
members.name: ImageType

members.document: Base64 encoded image content
members.name: ImageContent

members.document: Origin. Valid values: TOP_LEFT, BOTTOM_LEFT, TOP_RIGHT, BOTTOM_RIGHT.
members.name: Location

members.document: The watermark’s horizontal distance from the origin as a percentage of the video width. Value range: 0-100. Default: 10.
members.name: XPos

members.document: The watermark’s vertical distance from the origin as a percentage of the video height. Value range: 0-100. Default: 10.
members.name: YPos

members.document:
The watermark image’s width as a percentage of the video width. Value range: 0-100. Default: 10.
`0` means to scale the width proportionally to the height.
You cannot set both `Width` and `Height` to `0`.
members.name: Width

members.document:
The watermark image’s height as a percentage of the video height. Value range: 0-100. Default: 10.
`0` means to scale the height proportionally to the width.
You cannot set both `Width` and `Height` to `0`.
members.name: Height

members.document: Channel name, which can contain 1-32 case-sensitive letters, digits, and underscores and must be unique at the region level
members.name: Name

members.document: Inputs to attach. You can attach 1 to 5 inputs.
members.name: AttachedInputs

members.document: Configuration information of the channel’s output groups. Quantity: [1, 10]
members.name: OutputGroups

members.document: Audio transcoding templates. Quantity: [1, 20]
members.name: AudioTemplates

members.document: Video transcoding templates. Quantity: [1, 10]
members.name: VideoTemplates

members.document: Audio/Video transcoding templates. Quantity: [1, 10]
members.name: AVTemplates

members.document: Event settings
members.name: PlanSettings

members.document: The callback settings.
members.name: EventNotifySettings

members.document: Complement the last video frame settings.
members.name: InputLossBehavior

members.document: Channel ID
members.name: Id

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Input name, which can contain 1-32 case-sensitive letters, digits, and underscores and must be unique at the region level
members.name: Name

members.document:
Input type
Valid values: `RTMP_PUSH`, `RTP_PUSH`, `UDP_PUSH`, `RTMP_PULL`, `HLS_PULL`, `MP4_PULL`
members.name: Type

members.document:
ID of the input security group to attach
You can attach only one security group to an input.
members.name: SecurityGroupIds

members.document: Input settings. For the type `RTMP_PUSH`, `RTMP_PULL`, `HLS_PULL`, or `MP4_PULL`, 1 or 2 inputs of the corresponding type can be configured.
members.name: InputSettings

members.name: Id

members.name: RequestId

members.document: Input security group name, which can contain case-sensitive letters, digits, and underscores and must be unique at the region level
members.name: Name

members.document: Allowlist entries. Quantity: [1, 10]
members.name: Whitelist

members.document: Security group ID
members.name: Id

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.

members.document: ID of the channel for which you want to configure an event

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.

members.name: Type

members.document: Font size. Value range: 25-50.

members.document: Font color, which is an RGB color value. Default value: 0x000000.

members.document: Segment duration in ms. Value range: [1000,30000]. Default value: 4000. The value can only be a multiple of 1,000.

members.document: Number of segments. Value range: [1,30]. Default value: 5.

members.document: Whether to enable multi-period. Valid values: CLOSE/OPEN. Default value: CLOSE.

members.document:
The encoding method.
Examples:
`liveprocessor_H264`: Live transcoding-H264
`liveprocessor_H265`: Live transcoding-H265
`topspeed_H264`: Top speed codec-H264
`topspeed_H265`: Top speed codec-H265
members.name: ModuleCodec

members.document: The target bitrate (Kbps).
members.name: Bitrate

members.document: The transcoding type.
members.name: Type

members.document: The push domain name.
members.name: PushDomain

members.document: The target resolution.
members.name: Resolution

members.document: Watermark ID
members.name: Id

members.document: Watermark name
members.name: Name

members.document: Watermark type. Valid values: STATIC_IMAGE, TEXT.
members.name: Type

members.document:
Watermark image settings. This parameter is valid if `Type` is `STATIC_IMAGE`.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: ImageSettings

members.document:
Watermark text settings. This parameter is valid if `Type` is `TEXT`.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: TextSettings

members.document:
Last modified time (UTC+0) of the watermark, in the format of `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: UpdateTime

members.document:
List of channel IDs the watermark is bound to
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: AttachedChannels

members.document: Relay destination address. Length limit: [1,512].
members.name: OutputUrl

members.document:
Authentication key. Length limit: [1,128].
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: AuthKey

members.document:
Authentication username. Length limit: [1,128].
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Username

members.document:
Authentication password. Length limit: [1,128].
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Password

members.document:
DRM key, which is a 32-bit hexadecimal string.
Note: uppercase letters in the string will be automatically converted to lowercase ones.
members.name: Key

members.document:
Required for Widevine encryption. Valid values: SD, HD, UHD1, UHD2, AUDIO, ALL.
ALL refers to all tracks. If this parameter is set to ALL, no other tracks can be added.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Track

members.document:
Required for Widevine encryption. It is a 32-bit hexadecimal string.
Note: uppercase letters in the string will be automatically converted to lowercase ones.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: KeyId

members.document:
Required when FairPlay uses the AES encryption method. It is a 32-bit hexadecimal string.
For more information about this parameter, please see: 
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3826
Note: uppercase letters in the string will be automatically converted to lowercase ones.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Iv

members.document:
The URI of the license server when AES-128 is used. This parameter may be empty.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: KeyUri

DrmSettingsInfo.document: DRM configuration information, which takes effect only for HLS and DASH.

members.document:
Whether to enable DRM encryption. Valid values: `CLOSE` (disable), `OPEN` (enable). Default value: `CLOSE`
DRM encryption is supported only for HLS, DASH, HLS_ARCHIVE, DASH_ARCHIVE, HLS_MEDIAPACKAGE, and DASH_MEDIAPACKAGE outputs.
members.name: State

members.document:
Valid values: `CustomDRMKeys` (default value), `SDMCDRM`
`CustomDRMKeys` means encryption keys customized by users.
`SDMCDRM` means the DRM key management system of SDMC.
members.name: Scheme

members.document:
If `Scheme` is set to `CustomDRMKeys`, this parameter is required.
If `Scheme` is set to `SDMCDRM`, this parameter is optional. It supports digits, letters, hyphens, and underscores and must contain 1 to 36 characters. If it is not specified, the value of `ChannelId` will be used.
members.name: ContentId

members.document:
The key customized by the content user, which is required when `Scheme` is set to CustomDRMKeys.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Keys

members.document:
SDMC key configuration. This parameter is used when `Scheme` is set to `SDMCDRM`.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: SDMCSettings

members.document:
The DRM type. Valid values: `FAIRPLAY`, `WIDEVINE`, `AES128`. For HLS, this can be `FAIRPLAY` or `AES128`. For DASH, this can only be `WIDEVINE`.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DrmType

members.document: The callback configuration for push events.
members.name: PushEventSettings

EventSettingsDestinationReq.document: Destination address information in event settings

members.document: URL of the COS bucket to save recording files
members.name: Url

EventSettingsDestinationResp.document: Destination address information in event settings

members.document: URL of the COS bucket where recording files are saved
members.name: Url

EventSettingsReq.document: Configuration information of an event in the plan

members.document: Valid values: `INPUT_SWITCH`, `TIMED_RECORD`, SCTE35_TIME_SIGNAL, SCTE35_SPLICE_INSERT, SCTE35_RETURN_TO_NETWORK. If it is not specified, `INPUT_SWITCH` will be used.
members.name: EventType

members.document: ID of the input to attach, which is required if `EventType` is `INPUT_SWITCH`
members.name: InputAttachment

members.document: Name of the output group to attach. This parameter is required if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`.
members.name: OutputGroupName

members.document: Name of the manifest file for timed recording, which must end with `.m3u8` for HLS and `.mpd` for DASH. This parameter is required if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`.
members.name: ManifestName

members.document: URL of the COS bucket to save recording files. This parameter is required if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`. It may contain 1 or 2 URLs. The first URL corresponds to pipeline 0 and the second pipeline 1.
members.name: Destinations

members.document: SCTE-35 configuration information.
members.name: SCTE35SegmentationDescriptor

members.document: A 32-bit unique segmentation event identifier.Only one occurrence of a given segmentation_event_id value shall be active at any one time.
members.name: SpliceEventID

members.document: The duration of the segment in 90kHz ticks.It used to  give the splicer an indication of when the break will be over and when the network In Point will occur. If not specifyed,the splice_insert will continue when enter a return_to_network to end the splice_insert at the appropriate time.
members.name: SpliceDuration

EventSettingsResp.document: Configuration information of an event in the plan

members.document: Valid values: INPUT_SWITCH, TIMED_RECORD, SCTE35_TIME_SIGNAL, SCTE35_SPLICE_INSERT, SCTE35_RETURN_TO_NETWORK.
members.name: EventType

members.document: ID of the input attached, which is not empty if `EventType` is `INPUT_SWITCH`
members.name: InputAttachment

members.document: Name of the output group attached. This parameter is not empty if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`.
members.name: OutputGroupName

members.document: Name of the manifest file for timed recording, which ends with `.m3u8` for HLS and `.mpd` for DASH. This parameter is not empty if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`.
members.name: ManifestName

members.document: URL of the COS bucket where recording files are saved. This parameter is not empty if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`. It may contain 1 or 2 URLs. The first URL corresponds to pipeline 0 and the second pipeline 1.
members.name: Destinations

members.document: SCTE-35 configuration information.
members.name: SCTE35SegmentationDescriptor

members.document: A 32-bit unique segmentation event identifier.Only one occurrence of a given segmentation_event_id value shall be active at any one time.
members.name: SpliceEventID

members.document: The duration of the segment in 90kHz ticks.It used to  give the splicer an indication of when the break will be over and when the network In Point will occur. If not specifyed,the splice_insert will continue when enter a return_to_network to end the splice_insert at the appropriate time.
members.name: SpliceDuration

members.document:
ID of the backup input
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: SecondaryInputId

members.document: The wait time (ms) for triggering failover after the primary input becomes unavailable. Value range: [1000, 86400000]. Default value: `3000`
members.name: LossThreshold

members.document: Failover policy. Valid values: `CURRENT_PREFERRED` (default), `PRIMARY_PREFERRED`
members.name: RecoverBehavior

members.document: Segment duration in ms. Value range: [1000,30000]. Default value: 4000. The value can only be a multiple of 1,000.
members.name: SegmentDuration

members.document: Number of segments. Value range: [1,30]. Default value: 5.
members.name: SegmentNumber

members.document: Whether to enable PDT insertion. Valid values: CLOSE/OPEN. Default value: CLOSE.
members.name: PdtInsertion

members.document: PDT duration in seconds. Value range: (0,3000]. Default value: 600.
members.name: PdtDuration

members.document: Audio/Video packaging scheme. Valid values: `SEPARATE`, `MERGE`. Default value is: SEPARATE.
members.name: Scheme

members.document:
The segment type. Valid values: `ts` (default), `fmp4`.
Currently, fMP4 segments do not support DRM or time shifting.
members.name: SegmentType

members.document: The HLS package type when the H.265 codec is used. Valid values: `hvc1`, `hev1` (default).
members.name: H265PackageType

members.document: Input region.
members.name: Region

members.document: Input ID.
members.name: Id

members.document: Input name.
members.name: Name

members.document: Input type.
members.name: Type

members.document: Array of security groups associated with input.
members.name: SecurityGroupIds

members.document:
Array of channels associated with input.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: AttachedChannels

members.document: Input configuration array.
members.name: InputSettings

InputLossBehaviorInfo.document: Complement the last video frame related settings.

members.document: The time to fill in the last video frame, unit ms, range 0-1000000, 1000000 means always inserting, default 0 means filling in black screen frame.
members.name: RepeatLastFrameMs

members.document: Fill frame type, COLOR means solid color filling, IMAGE means picture filling, the default is COLOR.
members.name: InputLossImageType

members.document: When the type is COLOR, the corresponding rgb value
members.name: ColorRGB

members.document: When the type is IMAGE, the corresponding image url value
members.name: ImageUrl

members.document: Input security group ID.
members.name: Id

members.document: Input security group name.
members.name: Name

members.document: List of allowlist entries.
members.name: Whitelist

members.document:
List of bound input streams.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OccupiedInputs

members.document: Input security group address.
members.name: Region

InputSettingInfo.document:
The input settings.
The format of an RTMP_PUSH address is ${InputAddress}/${AppName}/${StreamName}.
The format of an SRT_PUSH address is ${InputAddress}?streamid=${StreamName},h=${InputDomain}.

members.document:
Application name, which is valid if `Type` is `RTMP_PUSH` and can contain 1-32 letters and digits
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: AppName

members.document:
Stream name, which is valid if `Type` is `RTMP_PUSH` and can contain 1-32 letters and digits
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: StreamName

members.document:
Source URL, which is valid if `Type` is `RTMP_PULL`, `HLS_PULL`, or `MP4_PULL` and can contain 1-512 characters
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: SourceUrl

members.document:
RTP/UDP input address, which does not need to be entered for the input parameter.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: InputAddress

members.document:
Source type for stream pulling and relaying. To pull content from private-read COS buckets under the current account, set this parameter to `TencentCOS`; otherwise, leave it empty.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: SourceType

members.document:
Delayed time (ms) for playback, which is valid if `Type` is `RTMP_PUSH`
Value range: 0 (default) or 10000-600000
The value must be a multiple of 1,000.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: DelayTime

members.document:
The domain of an SRT_PUSH address. If this is a request parameter, you don’t need to specify it.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: InputDomain

members.document:
The username, which is used for authentication.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: UserName

members.document:
The password, which is used for authentication.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: Password

members.document: Input statistics of pipeline 0.
members.name: Pipeline0

members.document: Input statistics of pipeline 1.
members.name: Pipeline1

members.document: The input stream address.
members.name: InputAddress

members.document: The input stream path.
members.name: AppName

members.document: The input stream name.
members.name: StreamName

members.document: The input stream status. `1` indicates the stream is active.
members.name: Status

members.document:
Log type.
It contains the value of `StreamStart` which refers to the push information.
members.name: Type

members.document: Time when the log is printed.
members.name: Time

members.document: Log details.
members.name: Message

members.document:
Push information.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: StreamInfo

members.name: Id

members.name: Name

members.document: Input ID
members.name: Id

members.name: Name

members.name: SecurityGroupIds

members.document:
Input settings
For the type `RTMP_PUSH`, `RTMP_PULL`, `HLS_PULL`, or `MP4_PULL`, 1 or 2 inputs of the corresponding type can be configured.
This parameter can be left empty for RTP_PUSH and UDP_PUSH inputs.
Note: If this parameter is not specified or empty, the original input settings will be used.
members.name: InputSettings

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.name: Name

members.name: Name

members.name: ImageSettings

members.document: Watermark text settings. This parameter is valid if `Type` is `TEXT`.
members.name: TextSettings

Audio transcoding template name array.
Quantity limit: [0,1] for RTMP; [0,20] for others.

Video transcoding template name array. Quantity limit: [0,1].

members.document:
Audio/Video transcoding template name. If `HlsRemuxSettings.Scheme` is `MERGE`, there is 1 audio/video transcoding template. Otherwise, this parameter is empty.

For other inputs, the quantity is 1.

SDMCSettingsInfo.document: SDMC DRM configuration information. This parameter is valid only when `Scheme` is set to `SDMCDRM`.

members.document: User ID in the SDMC DRM system
members.name: Uid

members.document:
Tracks of the SDMC DRM system. This parameter is valid for DASH output groups.
`1`: audio
`2`: SD
`4`: HD
`8`: UHD1
`16`: UHD2

Default value: `31` (audio + SD + HD + UHD1 + UHD2)
members.name: Tracks

members.document: Key ID in the SDMC DRM system; required
members.name: SecretId

members.document: Key in the SDMC DRM system; required
members.name: SecretKey

members.document: Key request URL of the SDMC DRM system, which is `https://uat.multidrm.tv/cpix/2.2/getcontentkey` by default
members.name: Url

members.document: Token name in an SDMC key request URL, which is `token` by default
members.name: TokenName

members.document: Whether to pass through SCTE-35 information. Valid values: NO_PASSTHROUGH/PASSTHROUGH. Default value: NO_PASSTHROUGH.
members.name: Behavior

members.document: A 32-bit unique segmentation event identifier. Only one occurrence of a given segmentation_event_id value shall be active at any one time.
members.name: EventID

members.document: Indicates that a previously sent segmentation event, identified by segmentation_event_id, has been cancelled.
members.name: EventCancelIndicator

members.document: Distribution configuration.
members.name: DeliveryRestrictions

members.document: The duration of the segment in 90kHz ticks. indicat when the segment will be over and when the next segmentation message will occur.Shall be 0 for end messages.the time signal will continue until insert a cancellation message when not specify the duration.
members.name: Duration

members.document: Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid_type parameter.
members.name: UPIDType

members.document: Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid.
members.name: UPID

members.document: Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_type_id.
members.name: TypeID

members.document: Corresponds to SCTE-35 segment_num。This field provides support for numbering segments within a given collection of segments.
members.name: Num

members.document: Corresponds to SCTE-35 segment_expected.This field provides a count of the expected number of individual segments within a collection of segments.
members.name: Expected

members.document: Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segment_num.This field provides identification for a specific sub-segment within a collection of sub-segments.
members.name: SubSegmentNum

members.document: Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segments_expected.This field provides a count of the expected number of individual sub-segments within the collection of sub-segments.
members.name: SubSegmentsExpected

TimeShiftSettingsInfo.document: Time-shift configuration. This parameter is valid only for HLS_ARCHIVE and DASH_ARCHIVE output groups.

members.document:
Whether to enable time shifting. Valid values: `OPEN`; `CLOSE`
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: State

members.document:
Domain name bound for time shifting
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: PlayDomain

members.document:
Allowable time-shift period (s). Value range: [600, 1209600]. Default value: 300
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: StartoverWindow

members.document:
Whether to automatically delete finished recording events. Valid values: `CLOSE`, `OPEN`. If this parameter is left empty, `CLOSE` will be used.
If it is set to `OPEN`, a recording event will be deleted 7 days after it is finished.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: AutoClear

members.document: Event trigger type. Valid values: `FIXED_TIME`, `IMMEDIATE`. This parameter is required if `EventType` is `INPUT_SWITCH`.
members.name: StartType

members.document:
This parameter is required if `EventType` is `INPUT_SWITCH` and `StartType` is `FIXED_TIME`.
It must be in UTC format, e.g., `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`.
members.name: Time

members.document:
This parameter is required if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`.
It specifies the recording start time in UTC format (e.g., `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`) and must be at least 1 minute later than the current time.
members.name: StartTime

members.document:
This parameter is required if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`.
It specifies the recording end time in UTC format (e.g., `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`) and must be at least 1 minute later than the recording start time.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: Event trigger type
members.name: StartType

members.document:
Not empty if `StartType` is `FIXED_TIME`
UTC time, such as `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`
members.name: Time

members.document:
This parameter cannot be empty if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`.
It indicates the start time for recording in UTC format (e.g., `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`) and must be at least 1 minute later than the current time.
members.name: StartTime

members.document:
This parameter cannot be empty if `EventType` is `TIMED_RECORD`.
It indicates the end time for recording in UTC format (e.g., `2020-01-01T12:00:00Z`) and must be at least 1 minute later than the start time for recording.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: Video FPS.
members.name: Fps

members.document: Video bitrate in bps.
members.name: Rate

members.document: Video `Pid`, which is available only if the input is `rtp/udp`.
members.name: Pid

members.document: Video transcoding template name, which can contain 1-20 letters and digits.
members.name: Name

members.document: Video codec. Valid values: H264/H265. If this parameter is left empty, the original value will be used.
members.name: Vcodec

members.document: Video bitrate. Value range: [50000,40000000]. The value can only be a multiple of 1,000. If this parameter is left empty, the original value will be used.
members.name: VideoBitrate

members.document: Video width. Value range: (0,3000]. The value can only be a multiple of 4. If this parameter is left empty, the original value will be used.
members.name: Width

members.document: Video height. Value range: (0,3000]. The value can only be a multiple of 4. If this parameter is left empty, the original value will be used.
members.name: Height

members.document: Video frame rate. Value range: [1,240]. If this parameter is left empty, the original value will be used.
members.name: Fps

members.document: Whether to enable top speed codec. Valid value: CLOSE/OPEN. Default value: CLOSE.
members.name: TopSpeed

members.document: Top speed codec compression ratio. Value range: [0,50]. The lower the compression ratio, the higher the image quality.
members.name: BitrateCompressionRatio

members.document: Bitrate control mode. Valid values: `CBR`, `ABR` (default)
members.name: RateControlMode

members.document:
Watermark ID
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.
members.name: WatermarkId
